Package javelin.controller.scenario

Class Scenario

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.scenario.Scenario
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArtOfWar, Campaign
    public class Scenario
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    TODO scenario mode has been supplanted and disabled, might consider making this an abstract class with DungeonDelve and DungeonWorld depending on it instead to greatly simplify things. Scenario mode would be nice as well but there's already 4 game modes, not to count Minigames and that's way too much feature creep to maintain. Scenario mode is a much faster type of gameplay than the main Campaign mode. It's supposed to be finished on anywhere from 2 hours of play to an afternoon (but of course it can be saved an resumed too). The world is a lot more static in this mode. Several features and Locations are disabled - including RandomEncounters in ohe overworld map and Hazards. The only "moving pieces" in the world map are yourself and Incursions. The LocationGenerator is disabled after the original world is created, meaning that, wuthout random encounters and other infinite means of gaining experience and loot, you are on a race against time to conquer all hostile Towns - 1 to 3, with varying degress of power according to the quantity in each game. There is only one enemy Realm per game and the starting features are roughly made to be 1/3 neutral and 2/3 hostile.
    See Also:
    World.scenario, Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • size

        public int size
        World size.

      • minigames

        public boolean minigames
        Allow access to Minigames or not. TODO may allow access but should fix them for scenario mode where their UniqueLocations aren't present.

      • statictowns

        public boolean statictowns
        If true, Towns will be overidden after World generation according to #gettownel().

      • startingdungeons

        public java.lang.Integer startingdungeons
        If not null, this amount will be seeded during World generation. It will also be the cap as per Frequency.max. Number of starting dungeons in the World map. Since TempleKeys are important to Winning the game this should be a fair amount, otherwise the player will depend only on Caravans if too many dungeons are destroyed or if unable to find the proper Chest inside the dungeons he does find. Not that dungeons also spawn during the course of a game but since this is highly randomized a late-game player who ran out of dungeons should not be required to depend on that alone.
        See Also:
        Actor.destroy(Incursion), LocationGenerator

      • respawnlocations

        public boolean respawnlocations
        Whether LocationGenerator should continue placing features after initial world generation.

      • normalizemap

        public boolean normalizemap
        If true, all hostile Realms will be converted into a single one. Mostly for use on scenarios without Incursions anyway, to make it easier to process visually.

      • lockedtemples

        public boolean lockedtemples
        Wheter TempleKeys should exist at all.

      • easystartingtown

        public boolean easystartingtown
        true if first Town should be located on Terrain.PLAIN or Terrain.HILL.

      • startingfeatures

        public int startingfeatures
        Number of Locations to spawn. Ideally we want the player finding a new location every one or two steps into the unknown (fog of war), given that the map scale is very concentrated. LocationGenerator.
